Posted By: SkyknightXi (7/6/2012 9:01:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have nothing against throwbacks to simpler times, especially when they are accompanied by a reprinting of a Lord that, even after over 15 years, is still as powerful today. This lil' guy by itself my not see much play, but if you can draft a couple of 'em plus the Lord, you could have a fairly decent Blue aggro deck. I know we all like power creep, but sometimes it's nice to remember the days when it took more than a decent bankroll to win.  
  
When will [Mons's Goblin Raiders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mons's Goblin Raiders) see reprinted though? It's terrible, but there will always be a place in my heart for it as well.
posts.html:

This lil' guy by itself my not see much play, but if you can draft a couple of 'em plus the Lord, you could have a fairly decent Blue aggro deck. I know we all like power creep, but sometimes it's nice to remember the days when it took more than a decent bankroll to win.

When will Mons's Goblin Raiders see reprinted though? It's terrible, but there will always be a place in my heart for it as well.

Posted By: Anggul (7/20/2012 8:51:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: You know it exists only to be buffed by the [Master of the Pearl Trident](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of the Pearl Trident). Even the flavor text tells you so. They've been around since the earliest days (Alpha), have been variously allied with humans or not (in decks), and now they have a lord that will beef them up!

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (7/5/2012 5:31:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Much like [Mons's Goblin Raiders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mons's Goblin Raiders), this guy is a victim of power creep in the worst way. There are so many merfolk that cost U that are strictly better than this that you'd never ever use it.  
  
Not sure why they didn't just reprint [Merfolk Spy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk Spy).
posts.html:
Much like Mons's Goblin Raiders, this guy is a victim of power creep in the worst way. There are so many merfolk that cost U that are strictly better than this that you'd never ever use it.

Posted By: Radagast (7/14/2012 9:26:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A 1/1 vanilla with a tribal creature type is still only a 1/1 vanilla. Yeah, tribal stuff happens but those are extra cards you could be doing other stuff with. To add injury to insult, there have been a number of interesting, strictly better one-drop merfolk that could fill the same niche and more. This guy really doesn't have an excuse to be used in any format, even limited unless you manage to pull multiples of the lord, which is quite obviously unlikely. This hasn't been printed since 7th edition and it should have stayed that way.
posts.html:
